= Variable =
	* Us smallest variable type as needed:  
	* Short int: Whole numbers not fractions from -32k to 32k. 
	* Unsigned short: Whole numbers not fractions up to 65k
	* Float: A number with a decimal point up to seven significant digits
	* Bool:  Yes or No,
	* typedef allows you to rename a type.
	* If you don't want to change it make it a constant Constants start with Capital letters!
	* Enum if you only have a few options and you can only use one at a time:
		* Enums start at 0 
		  
	* Literals represent explicit value."strings" or numeric!

= General =

	* Logical operators have precedence!  Maybe this is why you get shit wrong sometimes...
